keyPolicies.policyTitle: Raising the Basic State Pension and Restoring the Link to Earnings
keyPolicies.policyDescription: The policy aims to ensure that Britain's older people are treated with dignity and respect by raising the basic state pension and restoring the link to earnings.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Ending the Scandal of Elderly People Having to Sell Their Home to Pay for Residential Care
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Under this policy, approximately 48,000 elderly people won't have to sell their homes for residential care each year.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: A Two Year Council Tax Freeze
keyPolicies.policyDescription: The Conservatives propose a council tax freeze for two years. They will offset a third of the increase in the basic state pension with savings made by cutting wasteful government spending.
This policy aims to keep neighborhoods safe with more visible police presence, specifically 'bobbies' on the beat.
The Conservative Party plans to raise the inheritance tax threshold to one million pounds, aiming to benefit those who have saved during their lives.

housing.content: Approximately 48,000 elderly people won't have to sell their homes to pay for residential care every year.

endorsements.endorsement: Supports the Conservative Party and believes their plans represent the best choice for pensioners, emphasizing the need for a government that will stand up for pensioners and ensure they are treated with dignity and respect.
